alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:15PM CDT until March 24 at 1:22AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... East Fork Angelina River Near Cushing affecting Nacogdoches and Rusk Counties. For the East Fork Angelina River...including Cushing...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork Angelina River Near Cushing. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Expect flooding of several secondary roadways. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CDT Tuesday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 11/18/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 1015 PM CDT.
